From the results of this study, this recommendation is further supported. Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) produced by rhizospheric bacteria play an important role in plant-bacterial interactions and their impact on plants has been well-documented (Ryu et al., 2003; Bhattacharyya and Jha, 2012; Bailly and Weisskopf, 2012; Bitas et al., 2013). The first report of bacterial VOCs affecting plants was the in vitro induction of leaf necrosis by bacterial VOCs (Cook and Stall, 1969), but it was the discovery of bacterial VOCs promoting growth in Arabidopsis thaliana that stimulated active research in this area (Ryu et al., 2003).
